plugins.name: Daily Planner
plugins.description:
"Daily Planner" is a powerful Figma plugin designed to create custom, detailed daily timelines for planning purposes.


Features include:

  1. Custom Date Range: Set your planning period by specifying the start and end dates. The plugin will generate a daily timeline for the given period.
  2. Skip Weekends Option: The plugin automatically skips weekends, focusing on weekdays for your planning needs.
  3. Weekday Indicator: Each day is labeled with its corresponding day of the week, helping you stay organized.
  4. Week Separator: A thicker line is drawn at the beginning of each week, making it easy to visually differentiate between weeks.


The Daily Planner is a simple yet effective tool for visualizing your schedule, keeping track of deadlines, or mapping out project timelines.

plugins.name: CodeTea - Figma to Code (react native, flutter, swiftUI, reactjs, html, ios, android xml, compose)
plugins.description:
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oJp0QjgfXxI


Tool: https://codetea.io


Design and Build UI: Intuitive and Effortless

Explore the browser design tool, enabling you to craft desired user interface designs through an intuitive 'Drag and Drop' feature - Customize attributes effortlessly, multiple frameworks available for both iOS and Android


Turn intricate UI codes into simplicity

Craft user interfaces for mobile apps effortlessly and professionally right from your browser.

Conveniently import designs from Figma, Zeplin, and swiftly adjust components using the 'Drag & Drop' tool.

Generate precise code output across multiple frameworks: React Native, Flutter, SwiftUI IOS, and Kotlin Android.

The product's correlation level is a direct 1-1 match


Multiple frameworks for both iOS and Android

You can flexibly choose the appropriate framework for your project


Optimize your design-to-build process, reduce costs, and save time

With just a click, effortlessly create UIs and export design codes for your prototypes. The code is both readable and production-ready, maintaining a direct 1-1 correlation level with the product


Drag and drop tool mobile

  2. Alternatively, quickly import designs from Figma and Zeplin into TagJs.
  3. Tailor parameters for precise design alignment, covering colors, sizes, positions, and effects.
  4. Finalize by exporting the code for seamless project integration.

plugins.name: MockupMirror
plugins.description:
Mirror and sync any screen in your file to create user flows without creating more versions of content. Keep a single source of truth.

 

Sound interesting? Try it now in MockupMirror Playground...

https://www.figma.com/community/file/977797826186922410/MockupMirror-Playground

 

How to Mirror like a pro:

  1. Select any frame you want to mirror.
  2. Click +Mirror to capture a PNG image of the source.
  3. Paste Mirrors into your designs, on any page in the file.
  4. When you change the source design, click Sync All to update Mirrors.

 

What can MockupMirror do?

MockupMirror allows you to retain a single source of truth for your designs and keep everything in sync. It allows you to capture designs as PNG files that sync. We call these ‘Mirrors’. Jump instantly from Mirror to source for quick editing. Keep everything up-to-date with one-click sync.

 

Why did we create MockupMirror?

Complicated user experience flows and information architecture maps require designers to reproduce numerous identical versions of the same designs. Scattered instances are hard to manage and can fall out of sync with the original design. MockupMirror simplifies the design process by capturing PNG images of your designs to paste into flows anywhere in the file. Use hyperlinks to jump from image to source for quick editing. Sync changes with one click.

plugins.name: Paginate
plugins.description:
Add page numbers to frames and update them easily!


If you've ever wanted to use Figma for print design, or just export frames to a PDF, you might also have looked for a way to add page numbers. Look no further! ✨


Paginate works by selecting a component and replacing the text in instances of that component with page numbers.


Quick demo video.

  • [ ] Paginate instances of different components simultaneously (tabs)
  • [ ] Run separate instances simultaneosly using layer names

plugins.name: Eps Importer
plugins.description:
✨ Import Eps into Figma & FigJam

Import your eps files directly into Figma as vectors with fully editable text layers.


🪄 How to use:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Browse or drag-and-drop your eps file.
  3. Preview your eps file and check all the fonts in use.
  4. (Optional) Install “fonts in use” if you want to maintain the same fonts used in the eps file.
  5. Press the “import” button, and you’ll have your eps file directly in Figma as a fully editable vector.


🧩 Features:

  1. Import eps as a vector file without rasterizing.
  2. Find and list all fonts used in the eps file.
  3. Fully editable text layers capability.
  4. Limitless usage in Figma & FigJam.
  5. No registration required.


❓Frequently asked questions:

What are import credits?

Import credits are units that users can purchase to import Eps files. Each file consumes a certain number of credits based on the file size.


How are import credits calculated?

Import credits are calculated based on a "pay as you go" model, where you only pay for the credits you use. The calculation depends on the size of the Eps file you want to import. The bigger the file size is, the more credits it will consume.

Here's how it works:

  1. Files between 0 and 50 MB: 1 credit
  2. Files between 51 and 100 MB: 2 credits
  3. Files between 101 and 150 MB: 3 credits
  4. Maximum file size allowed: 150 MB (which requires 3 credits)

Note: Only successful imported files are counted.


Can I purchase multiple packages at the same time?

Yes, you can buy import credits in packages that suit your needs. We offer different options to accommodate various usage levels. You can find all available packages here.


How do I know how many import credits I need?

When you upload your Eps file, we'll automatically calculate the required import credits based on the file size. You'll see this information before proceeding in the plugin’s UI.


What happens if I don't have enough credits?

If you attempt to import an Eps file but you don't have enough credits, we will notify you and provide options to purchase additional credits in the plugin’s UI.


Are there any limitations on file size or number of imports?

The maximum file size allowed is 150 MB and there's no limit on the number of imports you can perform as long as you have sufficient credits.


Is there an expiry date or time limit on credits?

No, there is no expiry date or time limit on credits. You can use them whenever you need to import files without worrying about expiration.


Can I try the plugin for free?

Yes, we offer 2 free credits where you can try the plugin for free. This allows you to try and experience the functionality of the plugin risk-free.


📩 Feedback and support:

Your feedback is important to us! For comments, inquiries or assistance, please reach out to us at support@figmats.com


💭 Contact us:

Join our community for the latest updates, practical tutorial, future announcements and daily inspiration.

Website · TikTok · Facebook · Instagram · YouTube · X (Formerly Twitter) · LinkedIn

plugins.name: Tailwind CSS
plugins.description:
Generate styles and other cool stuff straight out of your tailwind config file? This plugin already supports adding your color styles and has more features coming up in the future ~


Usage:


Method 1 - Use the default values:

- Press "Load default" (next to "Add Styles")


Method 2 - Generate a resolved config:

- Navigate to your tailwind project

- Run npx tailwind.json

- Grab the generated tailwind.json

plugins.name: Calendar Dates Generator
plugins.description:
Fill out your own, custom calendar component with real dates!


There're only two prerequisites:

  1. The day component of your calendar should be called ".calendar-day"
  2. The text layer for month and year should be "Month YYYY"


To run the plugin:

  1. Select your calendar frame
  2. Open the plugin, select month / week start / year
  3. Click "create calendar" ✨


Note: if you change fonts, close and reopen the plugin so that they get loaded there too.


Please let me know if you have any questions or feedback -> mash[at]hey[dot]com :)


3-min overview on YouTube.

plugins.name: A11y - Focus Order
plugins.description:
About this plugin

The A11y - Focus Order plugin lets you add accessibility annotations over your designs for the interactive elements of desktop, website, and mobile applications. You can share these annotations with engineers as part of your design. Accessibility is critical for good design. Making your designs accessible makes them easier to use for everyone. Our plugin addresses a very specific corner of accessibility. As designers, we often think about accessibility visually, in terms of color contrast, type readability, etc. This plugin addresses accessibility for keyboarding and screen reader software. It helps designers and engineers create a plan for how their product will interact with this technology so that screen readers can communicate properly with their users.


Annotating the focus/tab order for your designs is critical for accessibility

To create websites and applications that are inclusive and accessible to everyone, the designs that you create need to be device independent, which means that anyone can interact with your designs regardless of whether they’re using a mouse, keyboard, touch, gaze, or voice.


With this plugin you can

  1. Add accessibility annotations over your design
  2. Bulk add, remove, reorder, and update your annotations
  3. Create multiple annotation sets that can be named and styled with a different color
  4. Annotations are stored in a single layer group that can be toggled on/off


What’s new in this update

  1. Improved accessibility of the UI using Fluent controls. They are clearer, meet contrast requirements, and are keyboard accessible.
  2. Added the ability to identify the platform when creating an annotation spec. iOS and Android components are available to use, and the spec will point to the iOS and Material Design pages, respectively.
  3. In the UI each spec has an icon to reflect the platform it’s made for.
  4. Annotation table reflects the name of each set now. Finally, right?
  5. Added a playground file with the tutorial and example UI to try out the plugin.
  6. Resolved a number of bugs to improve performance and reliability. It is obviously faster and only redraws what it needs to now instead of redrawing the entire set for every edit, addition or removal.
  7. Can now edit the component names and notes directly in the table


Learn more about the plugin and accessibility best practices

Walk through the tutorial for this plugin. To learn more about accessibility for the web visit w3.org. Check out the WAI-ARIA patterns for the most common elements you’ll use https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/. Learn how to write web content that is more accessible to people with disabilities https://www.w3.org/WAI/tips/writing/.


This plugin is brought to you by Microsoft

Special thanks to Himanshu Shah and HCL Corp., Clint Covington, Manika Malhotra, David Snow, Jackie Tidwell, Andrea Fowler, Emily McLean, Ben Truelove and most especially our closer, Kelly Gorr.

plugins.name: Simplify
plugins.description:
Simplifies vector paths by automatically reducing and rearranging their line segments. 

Select one or more vector paths you want to  simplify and run the plugin — it will  simplify the selected paths and they will look smoother.

The plugin uses De Casteljau's algorithm to rasterize the vector paths first, and then applies Ramer–Douglas–Peucker algorithm to simplify them.

Sources can be found at: https://github.com/zserge/figma-simplify-path

plugins.name: Translations for figma - Localization toolbox
plugins.description:
Translate Your Figma Designs Instantly!


Tired of manually translating your Figma designs? This plugin makes it a breeze!


Key Features:

  1. Instant translation: Translate text layers and entire pages with a single click.
  2. Multiple languages: Support a wide range of languages through Google Translate, Figmat services, and Yandex.
  3. Interactive mode: Easily switch between languages to test your designs.
  4. Customization: Choose your preferred translation provider, save favorite languages, and customize the plugin's UI.
  5. Font style preservation: Maintain your original font styles across all languages.
  6. Translation history: Download translations as JSON files for easy management.
  7. Automate with Figmat API: Streamline your localization workflow with our API. Integrate translations into your CI pipeline for seamless build support.
  8. Dev Mode: Access all translations for each text layer, simplifying code integration and localization workflows.
  9. AI-Powered Text Enhancement: Improve your translations with AI-powered tools.
  10. Quick Review: Get instant feedback on your translations with AI-powered suggestions for improvement.



Get Started:

  1. Install the plugin.
  2. Select the text layers or frames you want to translate.
  3. Select your target language from the plugin's menu.


Learn More:

Visit our website: Translator for Figma

Watch tutorials: https://youtu.be/oNZtMCC7dYs


Notes:

  1. Google Translate has usage limits. If you encounter issues, check https://translate.google.com and try again later. For higher volume or more language options, consider Figmat services.
  2. Yandex Translate API key.



————


所见即所得的翻译插件

plugins.name: Component Cloner
plugins.description:
Ever wanted to iterate upon an idea made with components without messing with existing ones and copy variations between its instances?


With component cloner, you can select component instances you want to copy and they'll be assigned to a new copy of their original master component.


You can also just make a clone of a component.


Now you can keep the text, images, and other variations in your instances without having to repeat yourself.

plugins.description:
The fastest way to apply your brand colors in FigJam 🎨 Built for speed: use automatic one-click recoloring to quickly apply your palette, then use selection colors section to make more precise adjustments in bulk.


Paint is becoming paid soon! Get a no-subscription lifetime license for the early bird price! 🤑


The default set of swatches includes a set of useful swatches which are not available in FigJam natively such as TRUE RED™, bright blue and pink. Default swatches will be free to use forever!


Use your own colors 🎨

Get styles from the file: open a Figma file which contains solid color styles and run the “Save Palette” command.


Get colors from selected objects: select color swatches (rectangles or ellipses filled with different colors) and run “Save Palette” command.

plugins.name: Design Systems
plugins.description:
Design Systems is a Figma plugin that helps designers quickly create grid layouts within frames. It simplifies the process of setting up grid structures, allowing users to define the number of rows and columns and automatically generating the layout. Design Systems leverages Figma's layout grid feature to create consistent and responsive grid systems. With Design Systems, designers can easily align and organize their design elements using familiar grid patterns, saving time and effort in the layout creation process.


Key Features:

  • Create grid layouts within frames
  • Define the number of rows and columns
  • Utilize Figma's layout grid feature for consistency
  • Adjust gutter sizes and alignments
  • Visualize the grid for precise element placement
  • Supports responsive grid designs
  • Improve design efficiency and organization

Design Systems simplifies the process of creating grid layouts, making it a valuable tool for designers who frequently work with grids and want to streamline their design workflow.

Functionalities

  • Two-color striped background creation
  • Angle input for stripes pointing to any direction
  • Width & Height input to adjust the background's size
  • Stripes width input to adjust the stripes width
  • Only a portion of the striped background is visible. If you need to adjust the offset of the stripes, just unlock the background and drag it inside the outer frame.


Future plans

  • Multiple-colored stripes
  • Adjusting the width of individual stripes


Contact

Discover our extensive mockup library and elevate your projects with high-quality, realistic mockups. Or, create customized mockups by simply drawing your angle, effortlessly turning your designs into stunning presentations.


Main Features:

  1. Mockup Library: Select a mockup from our library, then select your design from Figma. Instantly see your concept come to life. More mockups coming soon!
  2. Mockup Creator: Already have a mockup? draw your angle, and your design will automatically yet seamlessly adjust to your angle.
  3. Handles Frame/Image: Visual Mockups can handles both Frame or Image inside the Figma Canvas.
  4. Crop Image: Adjust your image and crop before implement it to the mockup
  5. New! - Introducing Multi-mask Mockup Support! Take your creative process to new heights with our groundbreaking plugin feature: Multi-mask Mockup Support. The plugin seamlessly integrate designs into multiple device mockups within a scene, with user-friendly controls for managing both masks.

plugins.name: Font Explorer
plugins.description:
How many times did you struggle to find the perfect font for your logo, landing page or app?

Font Explorer will help you test how your work looks with different fonts, with just one click you can view your designs with multiple hand-picked quality fonts.


To use:

1. Rename your Figma text layers to ‘#changeme’

2. Select the frame that contains the text layers

3. Select the number of variations (max 30)

4. Select the font category (serif or sans-serif)

5. Click ‘Generate’


Demo video: https://youtu.be/Cu8D3hjvQRg


Future updates:

- Custom selected fonts

- Add more font options


Made by:

- Bogdan Soare https://bogdansoare.com/

- Csaba Nacu https://www.csabanacu.com/

plugins.name: Linear
plugins.description:
Streamline work across design and engineering with the Linear plugin. Create and link Linear issues to Figma designs without leaving the canvas, keeping everyone aligned across teams and tools.


🔗 Link Linear issues to frames, sections, and pages

Run the plugin and see all the issues that have been linked to your Figma file. Select an issue to go to the linked frame, section, or page. Apply filters to focus on specific issues or sort by priority, status, and more.


🗺️ Navigate designs in context

Linked issues provide more information about what you are building. Scroll through issues to see the history of your design process and view the current state of development.


🔄 Work from Figma, Linear, or VS Code

• Update Linear issues from Figma, marking issues done or assigning issues to team members when designs are ready for development.

• From Linear, see a list of linked designs or add additional frames, sections, and pages.

• The Linear plugin can also be used from the Figma for VS Code extension.


🪄 Bring the magic of Linear to Figma

• Matching dark and light themes that blend seamlessly with Figma

• Rich text formatting in issue descriptions

• Quick filters to instantly find issues relevant to you


Learn more about the plugin and how it works in our interactive release page or watch a demo video.


Need help? Contact our support team or ask in our Slack community.

accepted.description:

planning and building products

plugins.tagline: Bring the magic of Linear to Figma

plugins.name: Quick Mockups - Create instant mockups!
plugins.description:
Quick Mockups lets you apply realistic device mockups to your Figma frames in a single click! Choose from a wide selection of devices, including iPhones, Androids, MacBooks, iPads, Apple Watches, and browser headers. Note: Make sure the selected frame matches the device's specific dimensions to create a flawless mockup!


Supported Devices and Frame Sizes:


Phones:


  1. iPhone 16 – 393 x 852
  2. iPhone 16 Pro – 402 x 874
  3. iPhone 16 Pro Max – 440 x 956
  4. iPhone 16 Plus – 430 x 932
  5. iPhone 14 & 15 Pro Max – 430 x 932
  6. iPhone 14 & 15 Pro – 393 x 852
  7. iPhone 13 & 14 – 390 x 844
  8. iPhone 14 Plus – 428 x 926
  9. Android Compact – 412 x 917


Laptops:


  1. MacBook Air – 1280 x 832
  2. MacBook Pro 14" – 1512 x 982
  3. MacBook Pro 16" – 1728 x 1117


Watches:


  1. Apple Watch Series 10 42mm – 187 x 223
  2. Apple Watch Series 10 46mm – 208 x 248


Browsers:

(For frame widths greater than 1250px)


Tablets:


  1. Android Expanded – 1280 x 800
  2. iPad Mini 8.3" – 744 x 1133
  3. iPad Pro 11" – 834 x 1194
  4. iPad Pro 12.9" – 1024 x 1366


Ensure the selected frame size matches the device’s dimensions above to apply the mockup perfectly. Elevate your UI designs with Quick Mockups today!


Do like and share if it helps!

accepted.description: I'm a Product Designer who's always tinkering with the latest tools and technologies.

plugins.name: Arrow Pointer
plugins.description:
Arrow Pointer (green)

"This one" / "Start here"


Create arrow pointer over your selections with a click of a button.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select "Arrow Pointer" from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a pointer arrow!


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  • Go to System Preferences
  • Search for Keyboard
  • Click on Shortcuts tab
  • Search for "App Shortcuts"
  • Add Figma.app
  • Click on the + and Type in: "Arrow Pointer"
  • Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+\
  • That's it!


Enjoy!



(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)
plugins.tagline: Create arrow pointer over your selections with a click of a button.

plugins.name: MagicPattern Toolbox
plugins.description:
MagicPattern is a toolbox with 14 design tools that helps you generate graphics like gradients, patterns, blobs, and fun image effects in seconds.


Available tools:

• Confetti Generator

• Grid Patterns

• Polka Dot Patterns

• Geometric Patterns

• Seamless Patterns

• Blob Composition

• Mesh Gradients

• Blob Generator

• Wave Generator

• Chart Generator

• Iphone 13 gradient Generator

• Fractal Glass Effect Generator

• Dither Effect Generator

• God Rays Generator


Set up your API key

  1. Visit your personal account page
  2. Copy your API key
  3. Run the "Set API key" command and save your API key


How to use the Figma plugin

Get started with the MagicPattern Figma plugin by simply selecting an image layer or Frame, and run the MagicPattern command that opens your favorite tool.


Customize your graphic and when you're done, click "Export" to choose the format that you want to import into your Figma canvas.


Is it free?

Most tools are completely free!


Some features are locked and you need to upgrade to the MagicPattern Basic plan to use them.

accepted.name: Jim Raptis
accepted.description: Crafting handy tools to modernize design process

plugins.tagline: Generate patterns, gradients, blobs, and more, with 14 design tools
